result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J. Berger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew J. Berger in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Andrew J. Berger in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 16CF93 and 15CM324.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Case 16CF93 Count 2, 3, & 4: No Contests
Case 15CM324: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim is present today and does not wish to speak today.
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF93 Count 2, 3, 4 and 15CM324.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 16CF93 count 1 is dismissed and read in.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson concurs with joint agreement and requests concurrent stayed jail and early discharge at 18 mo. 

BY THE COURT: ****
16CF93 Count 2:  I/S Sentence: 9 mo jail, concurrent to extended supervision currently serving, - stayed
24 months Probation - may transfer to Waushara County:
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
*Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor.
*Maintain full-time employment.
*Comply with any counseling as recommended by Agent.
*Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.
*Pay costs + DNA surcharges each count.
*No violent or abusive contact with April A.
*Not to be on the premises of Fleet Farm.
Agent may grant early discharge on both 16CF93 and 15CM324, if feels appropriate.

16CF93 Count 3: I/S Sentence: 9 mo jail, concurrent with count 2 stayed
24 months Probation: Same conditions. Pay costs and DNA surcharges.

16CF93 Count 4: I/S Sentence: 9 mo jail, concurrent with count 3 - stayed
24 months Probation: Same conditions. Pay costs and DNA surcharges.

15CM324 I/S Sentence: 9 mo jail, consecutive to any other sentence - stayed
24 months Probation: Same conditions. Pay costs and DNA surcharges.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing held on 08/19/16 - insufficient address
/s/ RJS - original filed in 16CF93
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew J. Berger  with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Andrew J. Berger in custody.  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This is a return on warrant  - 15CM324 & 16CF93
1:22 p.m. case  is called and appearances stated on the record.
ADA states the case on the record.
Court states there are letters from the defendant - court questions whether each party has received copy of them.
Atty. Halverson makes statement to the court.  Initial appearance to be done in 16CF93 and set bond in that case.
Court reads defendant's letter from February on the record indicating he was in custody in WAushara County and just released.

16CF93 - ADA concurs with Atty. Halverson's statement.
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Atty. requests a preliminary hearing.
ADA requests Bond of $1,000.00 -  CONDITIONS;  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
No Contact A.L.A. or her children, AP or KP and comply with conditions in 15CM324

Atty Halverson responds to the State's request for bond - requests a signature bond only.  

Court questions the victim - Victim responds to the court indicating she does not want a no contact condition.

ADA makes additional statement re: the bond.  Atty Halverson makes additional statement to the court re: contact with victim.

BTC:
No contact between the defendant and the victim and her children until a Family Safety plan is developed.  Thereafter the court may modify the terms of the bond.

$2500 - sig bond
No contact with victim or her children pending further order of the court 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Comply with existing terms of bond under 15CM324.

PO Box 274, Plainfield, WI 54966 - send notice to this address


15CM324 - this case should track with 16CF93  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm. in 16CF93
Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm. in 15CM324
